text: 12oz bottle pours a golden color without any head. Low carb. Mild sourness. Lovely balance of the hops and funk that melds seamlessly. Very easy drinking.

Bottle: Pours fully cloudy dark yellow with some fizz. Aroma: Initially intensely hoppy, could smell the dry hop notes of citrus, tropical fruit and earthiness while pouring. After tasting, the notes of tart lemon, funk, white grape, and light yeast dominate. Taste is generously sour with funk and subtle notes of white wine and wood, complex and interesting. Also a nice silky finish on the palate that isnt overwhelming. Overall: Came in with no expectations (except for seeing how cloudy it was through the bottle) and was happily surprised. I drank a fresh version but I wonder how it would stand up to time. Only downside is Im bummed I got a small bottle instead of a large one.

Bottle from Healthy Spirits Castro. Hazy orange color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, earthy notes, hops, yeast, ripe fruits, grass and grapefruit. Sour finish with citrus, hops, ripe fruits, yeast, grapefruit and grass. Excellent saison.

Bottle shared with Dave and Amanda care of Michael, huge thanks for this juicy treat. Pours an ultra hazy orange color with small to medium white head. Notes of pineapple, brett, peach, nectarine, oak vino barrels, dank hops, minerals, salt, and other beautiful notes. Layered and salivating tart in the finish. Bangin

Tap at SF Beer Week Opening Gala.

Pours hazy pale yellow.
Aroma: Funky Brett.
Medium body, matching sourness, some tartness, soft carbonation, refreshing, some fruit.
Lemonade-like, citric dry palate.
Great drinkability.
Good

bytemesis for the win. Thanks, bud!  Batch No. 5  
Pours a staggeringly effervescent strawed yellow. Head is noticeably vigorous and assertive, but its plump roundness makes it a lovable fuzz.  I smell strong fragrances of melted Neapolitan ice cream, bosc pear skins, dried (and diced) apricot, canned pineapple juice, mint sprigs, sourdough starter, and cave minerality. Leaving the glass out to warm does nothing to change its aromas.  Sourdough starter through --bready, yeasty, and acidic. Waves of mint, aged hops, microflora, sourdough, bread yeast, pineapple, dried apricot, sweat, and unripe guava invade the flavor as if it were a country America is currently in war with. Lovely. What a fantastic beer.

Bottle thanks to bytemesis. Holy aroma. Danky. Catty. Some tropical fruit. Citrus. Light funk and farm. Wowe. Some wine and grape too. Very clear pale gold. Taste is spritzy fruit, stonefruit, tropical with light funkiness. Juicy. Incredible. A really excelled fruit juice explosion. This is grate.
Cloudy yellow pour. Aroma lemon, grass, green grapes. Tastes tart citrus peel, some sweet tingly. some resin and oak. fantastic.

Bottle @ Home. Was super excited to come across this one. Cloudy orange colored beer with a tall white head. This is good. Holy smokes. Huge tropical fruit and citrus aromas here. Grapefruit, pineapple, passion fruit, and guava. Sort of a catty, green grape funk to it as well. Sweet melon comes through on the tongue along with the nice citric, zesty citrus notes and tropical fruit flavors. Slight yeast and some grassy funk. Really similar to the best of the Jolly Pumpkin and Anchorage farmhouse/sour/funky beers.
Bottle. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma has coconut, pineapple, grapefruit juice. Funky and complex tartness. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Sampled at a bottle sharing at the RBSG in Pittsburgh. Pours hazyb orange Amber with a white head. Nose of tropical fruit. medium body. Flavor is fruit and citrus tartness with funk into the finish. Very nice.
Not too much aroma. Great flavor on first sip. Very tart with good balance by the hops. Citrusy and enjoyable on a warm evening.
Sampled at rbsg. Sour lemony funk. A dry complex citrus flavor. All over the place. Melons, lemons, earth, bark, woods. Zest. So interesting.
Bottle thanks to James. Pours a cloudy orange with small white head that lasts. The aroma is funk, tropical fruit, floral. Thin, citrus, funk, juicy hop, tart, very nice.

Bottle. Hazed pale yellow pour, with a white head. Fruity, juicy, tropical fruit, tart, lemon, fruit juice hops, kiwi, and sweet tarts. Pretty good, but Im not hugely liking it. This has stupidly high ratings.

Nice aroma of funk and hops. Hazy orange with thin white head. Nice round mouth feel lets many different flavors compete funk, tart, sweet, hoppy, a nice textural zip as well. Pleasurable complexity.

750 ml. bottle from Perrys. Batch 5. It pours a mostly clear orange color with a white head that shrinks rather quickly. The aroma is really nice. Tons of brett and hops. Funky and tangy with orange, wood, barnyard, passionfruit, grape. Awesome. It reminds me of a Jolly Pumpkin or Anchorage beer, only hoppier. The flavor has lots of wine barrel, orange, passionfruit, vanilla, wet hay, and grape. Pretty much the same as the aroma, only more barrel influence. Very tart, but not overtly sour. Lightly spicy yeast notes in the finish with more barrel and funk. Low bitterness. Lots of hop flavor though. This was really good. Sudwerk getting into the sour game and killing it with this one! Seek it out.
Bottle - Lots of Brett and orange. Cloudy yellow with a decent white head. Bright and intense bitter sweet citrus. Bright and flavourful. Very refreshing.

On tap at Newport Pizza. Fruity aroma with white grape, pineapple, sour red cherry, and white gummi bears. Hazy orange under a lacy, white sheet. Decidedly sour flavour with red cherries, lotus root, blood orange, and low tropical hops. Dry, light body, high carbonation, crisp and clean.

Bottle courtesy of Håkan. Pours very hazy deep yellow with a frothy white head that leaves lots of thick sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and grassy with crackers, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, mango, papaya, pineapple, passion fruit, star fruit, moist grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sweet, sour, slightly grassy and crazy fruity. Mouthfeel is dry, tart and medium bodied. Finish is sour with crackers, white bread, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, mango, papaya, passion fruit, star fruit, white grapes, moist grass, pine needles, minerals, barnyard and lemon zest. Intense dry hopped sour saison. The fruitiness is just mind blowing and the rest of the beer with its barrel character and funk is pretty close to perfect. Actually this beer is pretty close to perfect!!!

750 ml bottle poured a clear golden a!ber with a lingering ring of ivory foam. Aromas of straw, barnyard funk, grapefruit, spice, pine and light yeast. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of straw, grapefruit, barnyard funk and light pine with a crisp dry tart lingering grapefruit finish.

Draught at Harrys hofbrau during a Sudwerk event. Aromas of lemon, slight must and other citrus are overtly showing. Hazy (purée) goldent with full white head that slowly retreats to a dusting over the top. Taste is well balanced mixture of citrus, tart and chaffed wheat providing a slight spice. Fantastic!

Draught at Rip Current North Park, San Diego. Cloudy yellow beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Sourish leather and funk aroma, grapefruit, yeasty, herbal, lemongrass, dandelions, lots of fruity hops bringing great balance. Sourish hoppy flavor, pine, mango, yeasty, spicy, dandelions, orange zest, funky, floral, some lemongrass. Great sour with great hops! Fantastic!

Capped 750 shared by Marcus. Pours translucent gold with a slight, transient white head. Aroma is uber fruity - lots of fruits from under the Southern Cross. Especially the Nelson. Med body or nearly. Flavor is earthy, some sort of bacterial result, and a lot of floral/fruit hop. Its pretty dry, and its rather citrus bitter. The flavor is just WOW!
Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours golden with an attractive white head and a strong citrus aroma. There is a moderately sour pale malt flavor with a dry wine finish. Nicely hopped too.
Bottle...Pour is golden with a white head...Nose is hay, dry oak, dry barrel, lemon peel, funky hops..Taste os some tartness, dunky gops, grassy, dry oak, hay; orange peel.
Sampled at WTWBA 2015 in Minneapolis. Hazy yellow pour, white head. Tart fruit, somewhat dry, some grape skin. Very nice!

The beer pours a medium yellow gold. Its clouded through, a glowy mass of color. Voluminous white head, fairly rocky. Pretty solid lacing. The aroma is funk and sour citrus saison goodness. Lime, tangerine, grape, peach, pepper, grass. Solid bretty funk. Its bitey citrus juice on top of a funky, fresh grain base. Light oak. Nice vinous note in the mix. Taste is moderately sour with very mild bitterness and a little bit of oak astringency. More juicy hop flavor with that spicy edge. Very juicy stuff. Nice blend of hops and sour flavor, probably helped by a light, soft but rich saison base. Its a very bright, drinkable beer. Soft, full mouthfeel. This is a very pleasant surprise from Sudwerk. They should make more beers like this because its legitimately comparable with other top sour saisons. It could use a little more funk depth, but this beer is already delicious as is.

Big bottle. Strong funky aroma of hay, wine and passion fruit. Tart w hints of champagne vinegar and wine but not too sour. Balanced hop notes and mild malty biscuit undertones. Citrus and passion fruit notes. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, B2, thanks to the guy who brewed it! Pours hazy orange, medium fluffy white head, dissipates fairly slowly, nice residual lacing. Aroma is very citra-esque, dank, tropical, passionfruit, some cat piss, stonefruit, hints of dust and Brett as well. Flavor is fairly dry, fruity, light Brett funk and an explosion of hoppy flavors, along with a nice woody vinous note. Light tartness accentuates the fruity hops and vinous barrel well. Medium body, spritzy carbonation. This is a world class beer. I wish I had a keg of this in the fridge. Yum.

(750ml bottle) Pours a cloudy golden body with a moderate white head. Aroma of lemon, mango, tangerine, herbs, and grapefruit. Flavor of grapefruit, orange, grass, white grapes, tangerine, grass, and wood with a dry finish.

At WTWBA another gem sampled today. Hazy dirty blonde. Nose is hoppy and citrus. Tastes of lemon, lychee, piney hops, Brett, grassy, and right amount of farmhouse notes. This is hoppy delicious and all that is wonderful.

Appearance: hazy golden, short white head, minimal lacing.  Aroma: bright, spritzy notes of lemon (and general citrus), funk, green apples, and honeysuckle.  Taste: tart lemon and grapefruit, some pineapple and/or mango, a bit of pie crust. Finish: 	tart sourness fades into gentle barnyard funk, with a nice undertone of biscuity honey sweetness and a clean dose of resinous, juicy hops. Notes: Nice balance between tart, sour, funky, and sweet. Very juicy. Bottle from the Rare Beer Club.

Good lord this is great. Cloudy yellow pour, white head. Perfectly sour, perfectly juicy, just enough funk, lemons, key limes, white wine grapes, perfect amount of vanilla hints, some oaky goodness. Nice beer. Really nice.

Super juicy tropical fruit smell. Taste is mild, crisp lactic sourness, lemon, tropical fruit, and a bit of saison character in the finish. Medium body, medium sharp carbonation, and very slight foam.

Shared 750 ml. bottle poured to snifters, showing a cloudy, orangey gold color, with a presentable layer of soft white head foam, and spots & strands of lacing. The nose was lightly floral, funk, a blend of tangerine & mandarin orange, and subtle spice. Light to medium bodied, with lively carbonation, the taste followed similarly, with expressive tartness, and a finish that combined a pleasant dryness with light rind & tannic astringency. Very tasty!
Bottle. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of sour lemon, oak, citrus, green onion and orange peel - medium body.
From RBC, poured into tulip glass. Cloudy orange with decent sized white head. Great tart citrus flavor with hint of hops, very nice lingering sour finish. I want more of this.

Very cloudy straw blonde with one finger of white head. Wonderful aroma, tropical fruit and dense acidic citrus with fruit skins and sweet lychee. Light acidity, green citrus, and hops. Very leafy and clean hops. Light bodied and dry with juicy hops on the finish. Marvelous.

A very cloudy golden yellow, light and bubbly head. Smells like lemon, hay, hops. Taste is tart up front, and the tartness lingers, rapidly decreasing in intensity. Some bitterness. Falls a little flat when the tartness dissipates. But it is a tasty, slightly sour farmhouse-style ale. Enjoyable.

750 ml bottle from Rare Beer Club poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Batch No. 2. Hazy golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of light barnyard funk, floral notes, light citrus. Tastes of lemon lime citrus, light funk, some tart and light acidic notes, light tropical and stone fruits, light floral. Dont really notice the barrel character if any. Nice balance between sour and saison, not too sour and not too funky.

750mL capped bottle shared by Pruf. A very cloudy, dirty pale color; doesnt look pretty. Small head fades. Thats the worst part of the beer. Aroma is lemon drop tartness, pear-y sharpness, slick airiness. Flavor has a slight lemony malt biscuit withy long tartness. Light feeling with slightly tingly feel. Its a nice mix of tart, lactic, citric and light airiness.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Bottle, courtesy of RBC. Hazy gold pour, white head that dissipates in short order. Aroma brings lemon, grass, lemongrass; loads of citrus, some grape, light toast. Taste is crisp, with light pleasant tartness. Pepper, decent dose of aromatic hop with citrus overtones, but only light bitterness. Light body, average carbonation. Dry finish. Overall: this is delicious. I could go for a few more of these.

750 mL bottle poured at a tasting. Thanks Chris! Pours a pale yellow color with not much head. What a nice suprise this is. Wonderful lemony citrus fruit, with a growing tartness throughout the palate. Juicy flavor, and the right amount of sweetness. Grape, apple, pineapple, and other tropical flavor. Very nice sour here. Loved it.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy blonde with a small white head. Nose brings out lovely dry hops along with a medium tartness. Flavour is really well-balanced, with loads of dry hops duking it out with light tart fruits. Complex, well-balanced and hugely drinkable. Excellent.
750-ml bottle from rare beer club. huge grapefruit + piney hop nose, softly sour taste, perfectly balanced. nice white head. batch #2. rating #1!
